title: Do you find the answer if you think hard enough, or are you just wasting time? - Quora

response.answer_text: Do you find the answer if you think hard enough, or are you just wasting time? Context matters to me. I can think as hard as I can about the problem of cancer, but I’m not going to be the one to solve the problem. Did I waste my time? The power of the unconscious mind also matters to me. The inspiration/perception that led to the discovery of the double helix shape for DNA was the result of a dream had by Dr. James Watson[1]. There are many examples of how unconscious processes led to scientific advancements[2] [3]. “Thinking hard” is a solution for certain kinds of problems, but it’s not a solution for everything. Sometimes, it is more important to think with less effort and more insight. Footnotes[1] List of dreams - Wikipedia[2] 7 Great Examples of Scientific Discoveries Made in Dreams[3] Famous Dreams Albert Einstein: Birth of a Scientific Theory

If I have a good supply of bricks, I can make a house out of them - but it takes time and effort. If I don’t have any bricks, no amount of time or effort will see me building a house. It’s the same with thinking. If you have all the information, you can eventually come up with an answer. If you don’t have all the information, you won’t, or you’ll come up with something very different (or, at best, a partial answer - I can still build half a house with half as many bricks).
I think we all can find a way if we don’t give up on things. If you need or desire bad enough, you’ll find the answer one way or the other.
It is, actually. I’m wasting time. Do you know that there is wonderful thing that in a click of a button you will find the solution?
